page.title: 12ST.PETER'S CHURCH
page.content:
On Tuesday 2nd July 1985 we visited Church Hanborough with Mrs Jones. At the church we met Miss Gibson who lives at 'Mylors' behind the pub, and who keeps the church keys. Above the door is a Norman carving of St.Peter. On one of the pillars inside the church are some pieces of glass to measure the structural faults. The hassocks on the floor were all hand-made, and in the church there is a small kitchen. There is an old clock which hasn't got a face. We sat in the seat where the churchwarden sits, opposite the organ.
Outside in the graveyard are graves of the Wastie family which is a very old family in this area. There are two boys called Wastie at our school and their dad owns the garage on the A40.
